entry.title: Why Does it Make Sense to Buy and Sell Right Now?
entry.content:
Selling a Louisville home? Get a free home value report
 
Buying a Louisville home? Search all homes for sale
 
Hey everyone, today I'm here on the lawnmower, trying to get the grass cut before the impending storm. I'm always working on real estate, so I wanted to give you an update on what's going on in the Louisville market, for both buyers and sellers:
  • The number of homes sold in April was up 6.3% over April 2014. 
  • The number of homes that went under contract in April was up an incredible 24.1% over April of last year. 
  • Buyer activity in the area has doubled over the past year, partly due to an impending rise in interest rates.
  • Interest rates are currently hovering around 4-4.5%, but there has been widespread speculation that they are going to increase to over 5% by the end of the year.
  • 5.2 million renters will be looking to buy in the next year, so there is a bit of concern that there won't be enough homes to go around.
If you have been thinking about buying or selling, get with an agent immediately. Conditions are perfect for you to get top dollar for your home sale, and lock in an affordable interest rate when you purchase. We use the latest technology on our listings, including our latest addition, 3D photography and models.

If you have any questions for us, we would be glad to help. Just give us a call or send us an email, and we'll be talking to you soon!

link.title: Why Does it Make Sense to Buy and Sell Right Now?

entry.title: Why Do We Use the Latest Real Estate Technology?
entry.content:
Selling a Louisville home? Get a free home value report

Buying a Louisville home? Search all homes for sale
 
Welcome back, everyone. Today I've got some news about the exciting technology we are getting. We are very excited about it and can't wait for you to see what we have in store. But first, let's take a look at the Louisville real estate market and the latest statistics that have come out: 
  • The home sale numbers for Louisville in March look very good, they are up 8.2% from last year. They are up over 20% if you include the number of homes that went under contract. 
  • Interest rates are driving buyer activity, hovering between 3% and 4%. This makes mortgage affordability and credit affordability more readily available.
  • Home appreciation is expected to remain up near 5% for the next few years.
  • Projections from Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac hint that interest rates will rise by the end of the year, up near 5%. 
  • The market is hot. Proof of this is that we recently listed a number of homes that sold within a few days.
Now, on to the technology. To give our online listings a little more "oomph," we have been using HDR photography to capture images of our listings, as well as HD video home tours. Now we have a brand new piece of technology that will combine the two mediums above: the 3D camera.

Nobody else in the area is using a 3D camera in real estate, but we see the great value in it. A 3D camera will be able to give you a dollhouse-like view of your house that you can see into, as well as walk through. You will not only be able to show buyers different views of your home, but they will be able to measure different rooms just from our camera. This technology allows us to help sell our homes faster, and for more money.

If you have any questions about the real estate market, or the new tech we are utilizing, feel free to give me a call or send me an email. Talk to you soon!

link.title: Why Do We Use the Latest Real Estate Technology?

entry.title: A Sneak Peek at the Future of Real Estate Technology
entry.content:
Selling a Louisville home? Get a free home value report
Buying a Louisville home? Search all homes for sale

Today I'm coming to you from Las Vegas where I just attended a conference for CRS (Counsel of Residential Specialists), but I'll give you more on that later. For now, let's talk about the market in Louisville.
  • Pending sales are up by 23.8% over last year at this time.
  • Consumer optimism has hit an 11-year high, and this might be because of a strengthening economy and high affordability. 
  • More and more renters are planning to buy homes, with 31% of people ages 18-24 planning to buy, 47% of 25-34 year-old consumers ready to enter the market, and 58% of consumers aged 35-44 are now ready to buy.
  • Mortgage rates are extremely low right now, with most major lenders offering products below 4% interest. However, by the end of the year they're projected to sit at 4.55%.
  • Private mortgage insurance rates have also fallen dramatically. On a $200,000 mortgage with a 30-year loan, you could save $18,000!
  • If you're looking to sell in Louisville, be aware that April, May, and June are the time when the most homes come onto the market. This means that now is the time to list your home in Louisville!
  • We're also expecting a lot of pent-up seller demand from home owners who are ready to buy or sell after recovering from the market crash.
Now, back to Las Vegas where I attended the CRS conference where we discussed the future of real estate. One unique product that was showcased was the Cicret bracelet, which projects a tablet screen directly on your skin, eliminating the need for a smartphone. You can answer a phone call by just tapping your arm!

Another unique product is the Nixie. It's a wearable drone bracelet that detaches from your wrist and will follow you around wherever you go. This is going to create some very unique opportunities for real estate photography in the near future!

As always, if you ever need help buying or selling real estate in Louisville, please be sure to contact me!

link.title: A Sneak Peek at the Future of Real Estate Technology

entry.title: What's the Future of the Louisville Real Estate Market?
entry.content:
There are many great Louisville area homes for sale. Click here to perform a full home search, or if you're thinking of selling your home, click here for a FREE Home Price Evaluation so you know what buyers will pay for your home in today's market. You may also call me at (502) 376-5483 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation to answer any of your real estate questions.

The Sokoler Team was off to a hot start in January, signing 6 contracts in the first 6 days of 2015, but when the cold weather came back the market cooled down as well.

However, the overall numbers looking back at 2014 are mixed.
  • Home sales increased in Louisville from December of 2013, but the overall sales in Louisville declined by 1.8%.
  • The good news is that projections for home sales in 2015 are rising based on surveys by the NAR, Freddie Mac, and MBA.
  • Home appreciation in Louisville is set to rise by 3.7% in 2015 and will rise by 3.2% in 2016. 
  • Mortgage rates have been a huge question mark, but it appears that a good estimate is that rates will fall between 4.25-4.88% by the end of the year.   
  • Some good news for buyers (which is also good news for sellers) is that there are new FHA regulations that will make it much easier for first-time home buyers and second-time buyers to afford homes. 
  • By the end of this month the FHA is going to cut out a 0.5 percentage point from its monthly mortgage insurance premium that is charged for using FHA financing. Last year premiums were so expensive that 234,000 eligible buyers were priced out of the market.  
  • The annual mortgage insurance premium has dropped to 0.85% (down from 1.35%). On a $200,000 mortgage this will save you $83 a month on payments.

Overall, if you're looking to sell your Louisville home, then get it on the market and get in contact with us as soon as possible. Don't wait and have your home get lost in a flood of listings in January.

For buyers in Louisville: I would advise that you pay attention to the fluctuating mortgage rates, because nobody knows exactly where they're headed in 2015.

If you, your family, or any of your friends are thinking of buying or selling a home in Louisville in 2015, please be sure to refer them to us. The Sokoler Team can capitalize on any sale or purchase in the Louisville area.

link.title: What's the Future of the Louisville Real Estate Market?

entry.title: What Does 2015 Have in Store For Real Estate?
entry.content:
There are many great Louisville area homes for sale. Click here to perform a full home search, or if you're thinking of selling your home, click here for a FREE Home Price Evaluation so you know what buyers will pay for your home in today's market. You may also call me at (502) 376-5483 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation to answer any of your real estate questions.

Welcome back, everyone. First, I want to take a moment to wish all of you a very Happy New Year as we bring 2014 to a close. We hope your holiday season has been filled with happiness and love.

Today, we want to give you some information on how the real estate market is doing now, and what we predict will happen with the market in 2015. First, let’s see what happened in 2014.

As of the 1st week of December, home sales in Louisville were down by 2.5% from 2013, which is right on point with country averages. In addition to this, home prices are increasing nationally as well. While we only saw a 1.7% increase here in Kentucky, states like Nevada saw home prices jump over 10%!

A few more things to note:
  • Inventory in Louisville is down, important information if you are thinking of selling your home in the next year 
  • With low interest rates remaining, experts are calling 2015 "A great time" for both buyers and sellers to enter the market.
Speaking of interest rates, there has been much speculation recently about where they may be headed in 2015. Some are predicting an increase of up to 1%, others are predicting they will stay where they are at. Today we talked to Jeff Ratanapool, COO of Century Mortgage, and asked him what he predicts for interest rates in the coming year.

Jeff believes that rates will stay in the low 4%'s throughout 2015 and if there is a spike at all, it will come in late spring or early summer, and rates won't go above 4.5%. How does Jeff figure this will happen?

Well, he points to global problems as the main cause. Civil unrest in Africa, the middle east, and Russia, as well as the ebola epidemic, are all reasons that foreign investors will get spooked, and jump into a safer market like the bond market. When this happens, interest rates come down.
 
If you want to know what home prices are doing in your specific neighborhood, just text BOB to 502-425-6100. You'll receive a reply with a link where you can search for all available homes in your area. The site has a lot of great features, I recommend you check it out.

If you have any other questions for me, be sure to give me a call or send me an email. I look forward to hearing from you soon!

link.title: What Does 2015 Have in Store For Real Estate?

entry.title: How Is Real Estate Security Improving?
entry.content:
There are many great Louisville area homes for sale. Click here to perform a full home search, or if you're thinking of selling your home, click here for a FREE Home Price Evaluation so you know what buyers will pay for your home in today's market. You may also call me at (502) 376-5483 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation to answer any of your real estate questions.

 Can you guess where I am today? If you said the French Quarter in New Orleans, you would be exactly right. The last time I was here was around 20 or so years ago when I was a reporter in Atlanta. It's so great to be back and the weather is gorgeous. More about why I'm here in just a moment. First, here is what is happening in Louisville real estate, for both buyers and sellers:
  • The number of home sales in November is down 22% from the numbers we saw in November 2013. 
  • Buyers are out there, but there are fewer homes for them to choose from. Right now might be a good time to list yours.  
  • Nationally, home sales will level off during the end of the year, but will reignite beginning in January.  
  • The average credit score being accepted by lenders is getting lower and lower, meaning more buyers will be able to qualify 
  • More good news for buyers: Interest rates are still around 4%, and we have a recipe for even better home sales next year.  
  • Many experts expect interest rates to rise by the 4th quarter of 2015. 
Back in New Orleans, we decided we had to stop at Cafe Dumont to get some of their world famous beignets. You have to try these at least once, but be prepared to wait anywhere from 30-90 minutes to get your hands on some.

The real reason we are here, of course, is because of the National Association of Realtors Convention. There are a lot of different and exciting new innovations to the real estate business we think are worth checking out, let us tell you about some of them now.

In real estate security, the big trend is mobile security applications. One app that we really like is called Emergensee. What this app does when you open it is start streaming live video and audio to a 24 hr monitoring station. You can put a timer on the app as well, and the monitoring center will call you if you haven't stopped the timer by the time it runs out.

Another really great piece of technology we saw was the solo protect. It's a remote monitoring device designed as an I.D. badge. If you are showing a home and for whatever reason feel uneasy, there is a concealed button on the back side of the badge that will bring up a live, one-way audio call to the emergency dispatch center so they can monitor what is going on. Real estate security is becoming more important every day and will continue to improve as our technology does.

If you haven't had the chance to check out my new show on 840 WHAS, join us this or any Sunday morning at 8:30a.m. And as always, if you are looking to buy or sell real estate in the Louisville area, be sure to give me a call or a quick email. I'd be happy to help you out.

link.title: How Is Real Estate Security Improving?

entry.title: What's Happening in the Louisville Market this Fall?
entry.content:
There are many great Louisville area homes for sale. Click here to perform a full home search, or if you're thinking of selling your home, click here for a FREE Home Price Evaluation so you know what buyers will pay for your home in today's market. You may also call me at (502) 376-5483 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation to answer any of your real estate questions.

Today's blog comes to you from the 2014 American Heart Association's Heart Walk, where up to 10,000 people joined the Sokoler Medley Team in downtown Louisville to raise awareness and money for congenital heart diseases and defects.

Before we get into more detail about this fantastic event, let's take a look at trends in our market:
  • Home sales for October were up 11.1% compared to the previous October 
  • Homes under contract rose 8.2% in the same time frame 
  • Buyer confidence has returned, as 60% of homeowners feel confident they could get their asking price if they sold today and 53% believe prices will rise 
  • Cost of renting is high: The Federal Reserve found that homeowners have a net worth 36 times that of renters
If you're selling, don't believe the myth that the winter isn't a good time to sell. Sure, foot traffic falls a bit, but there are still plenty of serious buyers looking for a home. If you're still renting, you should consider buying while interest rates are low. Building equity through home ownership is a great way to increase your net worth. If you would like to take a look at our buying and selling guides, reach us at Bob@WeSellLouisville.com.

Now, back to the Heart Walk. This year's celebrity host was Wave 3 anchor Shannon Cogan, who has a personal reason to work with the American Heart Association. Six years ago, her life changed immensely when she gave birth to twins, one of whom had a rare congenital heart defect called TAPVR. His pulmonary veins were not going to both sides of his heart, so he needed emergency open-heart surgery when he was only two days old.

In a short time, Shannon and her family learned a lot about a part of the body they hadn't given much thought to before. Her son is doing well now, but she still gives her time to raise money and awareness for congenital heart diseases and defects. The Heart Walk is an event that highlights the survivors of heart problems and brings together people who are passionate about heart disease and strokes. Many companies come together and compete to raise money for the cause, and countless volunteers go out into the community to educate people on the risk factors of heart disease. It's a great event and a worthy cause.

If you would like to get involved or donate, you can do so here. If you have any questions about real estate, or about what the American Heart Association is doing to improve people's lives, don't hesitate to reach out to us. This is something we are passionate about and we would love to hear from you!

link.title: What's Happening in the Louisville Market this Fall?

entry.title: Tune in to ABC's and CNBC’s Shark Tank to see Bob with real estate magnate Barbara Corcoran
entry.content:
Tune in to ABC's and CNBC’s Shark Tank to see Bob side-by-side with real estate magnate Barbara Corcoran.

Corcoran is Shark Tank’s resident real estate mogul and a prominent self-made multi millionaire. She is now endorsing a select few of the best real estate minds in the country, Bob being included. Bob will appear in a commercial airing in several episodes throughout the season.

Bob's company, The Sokoler-Medley Team, is a dominant leader in the real estate industry, providing phenomenal service and expertise to a wide base of clientele in the Louisville area.

“To sell your home on time for the most money, you need a sharp agent with a marketing strategy that creates the most demand,” Corcoran said. “Bottom line, you need a partner willing to put their own money on the line for you …. Bob Sokoler knows how to attract the right kind of buyers and create so much demand that if your home doesn’t sell at a price and deadline you agree to, Bob will buy it!”

Corcoran is an iconic figure in the New York real estate scene and nationally known as the real estate contributor to the NBC TODAY show. She has invested in more than two dozen businesses to date on Shark Tank, and has written several well-received books including Shark Tales: How I turned $1,000 into a Billion Dollar Business.

entry.content:
There are many great Louisville area homes for sale. A new talk show “The Louisville Real Estate Show" designed to explain the mysteries of Real Estate, hits the airwaves of 840 WHAS this Sunday at 8:30 AM! The half hour show may be new but the voice behind it should sound very familiar to longtime listeners. 

After 10 years off the air, former 5-9am morning show host Bob Sokoler returns to the air! “I’m a different Bob than people may remember” says the journalist turned Louisville Realtor. Sokoler says, “after leaving radio 10 years ago, I completely changed careers - you could say it was a midlife crisis!” Back in 2004 Bob Sokoler became a Realtor, joined RE/MAX Properties East and The Medley Team (a top rated Real Estate Team) and quickly became a shining star at the real estate office. Ten years later, (a name change to The Sokoler Medley Team after his partners retired), Sokoler and his team have grown. 

Bob has been the number one Realtor (for volume) in Louisville for the past four years. Sokoler says, “Starting Sunday I bring my real estate experience to radio to help buyers and sellers understand the complex process of buying and selling a home. The real estate landscape continues to change daily and there’s a lot of uncertainty in the process.” Bob plans on explaining the complexities of both buying and selling in simple easy to understand language as well as bring in industry leaders to discuss different aspects of the real estate buying process. 

His vast experience in broadcasting, and now real estate, promises to provide content that is both interesting and entertaining. Sokoler’s Real Estate team consists of his wife Norine and son Greg along with seven other top Louisville real estate agents. Sokoler says, “each of our agents not only has an incredible knowledge of real estate but also a love of people and a passion for helping. I’m hoping to have each of the agents contribute to the radio show!” Tune in Sunday at 8:30am on 840 WHAS for the premiere of “The Louisville Real Estate Show”. To contact Bob Sokoler call (502) 376-5483 or head to www.WeSellLouisville.com.

entry.title: Louisville Real Estate Market Update for Fall 2014
entry.content:
There are many great Louisville area homes for sale. Click here to perform a full home search, or if you're thinking of selling your home, click here for a FREE Home Price Evaluation so you know what buyers will pay for your home in today's market. You may also call me at (502) 376-5483 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation to answer any of your real estate questions.

We are here today in Charleston, South Carolina taking a scenic tour of the city via a rickshaw bike. We will tell you more about why we are here in a minute, but first, here are the latest real estate statistics for Louisville.
  • Home sales are down 15.1% from this time last year. Don't panic though, this is most likely due to the decreased number of short sales and foreclosures. The market is actually looking much healthier. 
  • Distressed property sales have reduced greatly in numbers over the past few years as the economy has been recovering. 
  • Housing prices have appreciated 5.6% since the bubble burst in April 2007.  
  • Nationally, home prices are appreciating steadily, another sign of a healthy market.
For the rest of the market statistics that we have for you, check out the blog on our website, weselllouisville.com. Now, back to South Carolina and why we are here.

We are here aboard a rickshaw in Charleston, in town for a conference with many fellow real estate agents; a gathering that we try to have on a regular basis to discuss our businesses. At this conference, we were delighted to hear from real estate expert Steve Harney, of keepingcurrentmatters.com.

Steve has some advice for buyers that are planning to wait until the spring to sell their homes. Normally, in the winter months, buyer activity drops off pretty dramatically, causing people to be cautious and wait until the spring to sell. That won't happen this year, according to Steve.

He says that this might be the best winter we've seen in a decade. There has been a pent up demand for homes, on both the buyer and seller side. People who want to move into their dream home can do so under these conditions and there will be enough buyers to move inventory along before the interest rates rise next year.

If you have any questions about the real estate market, or anything real estate related, give us a call or send us an email. We'd love to help you out!

link.title: Louisville Real Estate Market Update for Fall 2014

entry.title: How Can You Prevent Clients from Getting Upset When Charging Premium Fees?
entry.content:
Looking to grow your CPA Business? We help tax professionals and financial advisors develop tax planning expertise so they can get paid what they are worth by reducing clients’ tax to 10% or less! To learn more about the process of getting certified in tax planning, visit our website or contact me at admin@certifiedtaxcoach.com

Many tax professionals ask whether customers will be upset if they are charged value-based or premium fees when they are accustomed to lower fees. The answer to that question depends on the situation but ultimately comes down to communication.

We in the tax planning industry have the unique ability to actually quantify to the dollar exactly what we're worth to our clients. If we save someone $17,000 on their taxes, we know we're worth that much to the client. However, the client isn't always aware of exactly how much value we bring them.

That's why it is the your responsibility as a tax professional to communicate the value you bring to your relationships. If you do this, it is unlikely your clients will be upset by value-based billing. If they know your value, they are unlikely to get upset. This type of communication takes a little practice, but it will dramatically transform the way you're doing your billing.

If you have any further questions about the billing process, we're always available to chat. Give us a call or shoot us an email for the coaching tips that will make all the difference in your career.

link.title: How Can You Prevent Clients from Getting Upset When Charging Premium Fees?

entry.title: Louisville Market Snapshot - From the High Roller in Vegas!
entry.content:
There are many great Louisville area homes for sale. Click here to perform a full home search, or if you're thinking of selling your home, click here for a FREE Home Price Evaluation so you know what buyers will pay for your home in today's market. You may also call me at (502) 376-5483 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation to answer any of your real estate questions.

In February, it was announced that Louisville might build a large Ferris wheel at the new Waterfront Park area. It would be much like the one we're on now in Las Vegas, called the High Roller. It is billed as the largest observation wheel in the world and towers 550 feet into the air. It is a continuously moving wheel that takes passengers on rides of about 30 minutes. The massive structure took 3 years to build and charges $25 for day rides and $35 for night rides. The view is spectacular - but will something like this work in Louisville?

We could talk about Ferris wheels all day, but now it's time to focus our attention on the Louisville real estate market. Here's what we've seen so far this year:
  • The number of homes sold last month is down 7.5% compared to last year. 
  • Active listings are down 11%.
  • Inventory is 14% better than last year.
  • Home prices are up 2.5%.

What does all this information mean for you? Well, inventory is at 5.9 months, which means we're on the back end of a seller's market. Home prices in Kentucky have risen 2.5% this year, whereas they jumped 4.6% nationally - so we're expecting home prices to keep rising here in Louisville. If you're looking to sell, now is a good time to get a good price for your home. If you're a buyer, it's also a great time to act, as interest rates are still just above 4%. Buyers should also be aware, however, that with inventory where it's at, there may be less to choose from.

As always, conditions vary depending on the area. If you have questions about conditions in your neighborhood, don't hesitate to reach out to us. We would love to answer your questions and help make your real estate experience a successful one!

link.title: Louisville Market Snapshot - From the High Roller in Vegas!

entry.title: Louisville Real Estate Market Update for August 2014
entry.content:
There are many great Louisville area homes for sale. Click here to perform a full home search, or if you're thinking of selling your home, click here for a FREE Home Price Evaluation so you know what buyers will pay for your home in today's market. You may also call me at (502) 376-5483 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation to answer any of your real estate questions.

Welcome back everyone, today we are at the 6th annual Green Egg Festival. Delicious tastes and smells are all around, but before we get in to the great things going on here, let's talk about the great things going on in real estate here in Louisville. Here are 3 things you need to know:

1. Interest Rates
 Right now, interest rates are hovering between 4.15% and 4.25%. These are pretty good rates. Here is why they are so important: the lower you can lock in a rate at, the more your buying power increases. As the interest rate goes up, your buying power decreases and could cause you to miss out on the perfect home.

2. Home Prices
 If you're a seller, prices have improved pretty dramatically over the past year. If you're a buyer, understand that although prices are higher, they are much lower than they were in 2007.

3. Who's Buying? 
 In the next 5-10 years, the 18-34 and 35-44 age groups will be the most active in the housing market. These age groups will make up most of the buyers.
 
We are here at the 6th annual Green Egg Festival. This is an event with both great food and great people and the event raises money for the "Blessings in a Backpack" charity. All the food is cooked on green egg grills and boy is it delicious. The ceramic interior and egg shape is what helps the Green Egg grill cook both quickly and efficiently. It is much larger than you may think, and you can make a variety of dishes on the grill, including pizza and barbecue.
 
One more reminder: If you're a current buyer or seller or a past client, we have a 14-ft moving truck that you can use, free of charge. Give us a call if you'd like to use it and we will get you signed up. If you have any other questions, don't hesitate to call us or send us an email. We'd be glad to help!

link.title: Louisville Real Estate Market Update for August 2014

entry.title: Louisville Real Estate Market Update for August 2014
entry.content:
There are many great Louisville area homes for sale. Click here to perform a full home search, or if you're thinking of selling your home, click here for a FREE Home Price Evaluation so you know what buyers will pay for your home in today's market. You may also call me at (502) 376-5483 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation to answer any of your real estate questions.

 Today we want to give you a quick market update for the Louisville area. When it comes to real estate, things have been rather unusual in July. This is usually a fast paced month, but things have slowed down a bit this year. For much of the country, homes going under contract in June were on the rise, and home prices were increasing fairly dramatically.

In the Louisville area, the number of homes going under contract in July was up 6.5% from July 2013. However, the actual number of homes sold, or closed , in July of this year was down 12.1% from July 2013. There are many different factors that may have caused this, one being that there are 11.4% fewer homes on the market this year than there were last year. You would think, that with historically low mortgage rates, there would be more buyers out there looking for homes. It will be interesting to see what happens next year, as most people are predicting that interest rates may rise above 5% in 2015. You may want to buy a new home now before the prices, and rates, go up.

In another interesting piece of news, Zillow has announced that it is buying competitor Trulia for $3.5 billion. What does it mean to you? Really, nothing other than similar marketing between Zillow and Trulia. What does it mean for agents like us? More exposure is all.

If you'd like more information about the Louisville market or about buying or selling a home, we are ready for you to give us a call or send us an e-mail any day or night, even weekends. We look forward to talking with you soon!

entry.title: How this new piece of equipment will change the way you look at homes
entry.content:
There are many great Louisville area homes for sale. Click here to perform a full home search, or if you're thinking of selling your home, click here for a FREE Home Price Evaluation so you know what buyers will pay for your home in today's market. You may also call me at (502) 376-5483 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation to answer any of your real estate questions.

Today we are here in Chicago learning how to use a brand new piece of equipment. The  MōVI  stabilizer is a great piece of technology that will change the way you see homes. We will have more on this in a little bit, but first we want to share some exciting statistics from you about the current housing market in Louisville:
  • The number of homes going on the market has increased in June, which is typically a hot month for sellers, and due to this, the average number of days a home is on the market has decreased.
  • Homes going under contract in June is up 5.8% from June 2013.
  • The downward trend is continuing for the number of homes closing. In June 2014 the total was down 6.9% from June 2013. From a distance that trend is not a big deal, but after looking more closely at the problem there are some concerns that are causing fewer closings, including appraisals, mortgage companies, and home inspectors.
 So what are we doing here in Chicago? Well, as we said earlier we are testing out some new camera stabilizing equipment called the MōVI. We are taking things to a new level with this technology. We took a crash course in training on this new gear, and it was quite intensive as you can see from our video.  

The MōVI  is essentially a stabilizing camera attachment that allows you to move around with it while getting great, secure shots. The way it works is that the camera sits on a platform and moves counter to what the operator does, creating a stable picture. It is an amazing, smooth moving camera that will change the way you see virtual home tours.

entry.title: Louisville Real Estate Market Update for June 2014
entry.content:
There are many great Louisville area homes for sale. Click here to perform a full home search, or if you're thinking of selling your home, click here for a FREE Home Price Evaluation so you know what buyers will pay for your home in today's market. You may also call me at (502) 376-5483 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation to answer any of your real estate questions.

Louisville Real Estate Market Update for June 2014
Before I show off our new aerial drone to you, let me give you a quick update on the market here in Louisville.
  • Home sales have been down since December due to cold weather, but in April they began to pick up slowly. Foot traffic saw a steep decline in the wintry months, but pending sales shot up rapidly in March and April. 
  • One interesting poll I found tells me that people prefer buying new homes for their modern features, the ability to customize before construction, and because they require less maintenance and repairs. 
    • The main reasons people are buying resale homes is because they are cheaper, they have traditional features, and they are in established neighborhoods. 
  • Kentucky has been fairly constant with appreciation as there was a 2.6% increase in appreciation from this year over last year. 
    • More good news is that home prices have apparently bounced back to 2007 levels, and they are not expected to stop appreciating anytime soon. 
  • We also need to keep an eye on interest rates. Thirty-year fixed rate mortgages fell in the last month to 4.25%, but they are set to change in the near future. Some predict rates to shoot up to 5.5% by the first quarter of 2015.

Now...back to the drone that we just purchased. We will be using it to capture breathtaking photos and panoramas of your home in Louisville. As you can see, we are currently using this aerial drone to market our properties and also plots of land. Lot 17B on Tobacco Road in L'Esprit is a lot we used the drone to market, and our other property is at 4362 Mt. Eden Rd. in Shelbyville. This is a great tool to showcase not only homes, but the neighborhoods that surround them.

Please contact us if you're interested in listing your home with us, or if you're interested in buying property here in Louisville. We would be more than happy to assist you.

link.title: Louisville Real Estate Market Update for June 2014

  • Interest in buying a home has increased, with 59% of millennials wanting to buy, and 45% of move-up buyers wanting to sell their home and purchase a new one.
  • ROI for real estate investments is still beating the DOW, NASDAQ, and the S&P with a 65% return.

entry.title: Louisville Real Estate Market Update for April 2014
entry.content:
There are many great Louisville area homes for sale. Click here to perform a full home search, or if you're thinking of selling your home, click here for a FREE Home Price Evaluation so you know what buyers will pay for your home in today's market. You may also call me at (502) 376-5483 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation to answer any of your real estate questions.

Update for Buyers / Sellers in the Louisville Area
  • You may have seen an article in Business First that I was quoted in. The article points to a warming trend in our Louisville market that was brought on by March home sales, and I was quoted saying that the number of homes under contract is up by 8.7% since last March.
  • The Courier-Journal also had an article that quoted me saying, "The market has really come back, and Louisville has come back better than we ever hoped for. We've dealt with six or seven years of just poor home sales." Improving weather conditions were directly responsible for people coming out and looking at more homes.
  • Interest rates are also holding steady at about 4.5%, but these are expected to spike to nearly 5.5% by the end of the year. This means if you're thinking about buying, you should take action or consult with a Louisville realtor very soon.
  • Data shows that millennials are getting eager to buy homes, with 31% of real estate transactions occurring in their demographic. 
    • 85% of millennials plan to buy in the future, and 49% want to buy a home in the next 2 years.
    • Baby boomers are also rearing to move, with 57% of them planning to move from their current properties. 
  • If you still think home prices are too high, then you should be reminded that prices are still 16.9% below their peak in 2006. 
    • The monthly mortgage for a $200,000 dollar home with our current interest rates would cost $997. This is a much more affordable monthly mortgage compared to the 1980's when interest was at 12.7% and a monthly mortgage for a similar property would be $2,166 dollars per month. Bottom line is that homes are more affordable now than ever!

The Kentucky Kids Center Needs Your Donations!
Now, you may be wondering why I'm down at the Louisville Kids Center. A couple of months ago I was hosting a fundraiser with my former Louisville Tonight Live partner, Kirby Adams. The kids invited me for a tour, and I have taken them up on their offer. Jim Littlefield-Dalmares gave me a tour and showed me first-hand how they assist children with developmental challenge. Their goal is to look beyond a child's disability and find their true abilities. They work with 300 children per week and provide speech therapy, as well as physical and occupational therapy.

This center was founded by parents who made a vow to help every child, even if the money was not there to help provide the treatment. Funding is the biggest issue affecting the Kids Center, and hopefully this will change soon. 

If you'd like to learn more about the Kids Center or about the 10th Annual 2 Mile Fundraiser (on May 17th), just visit www.KidsCenterKY.org.

As always, if you would like more information about buying, selling, or investing in Louisville real estate, then please do not hesitate to call me. I would love to arrange a time for us to sit down and talk about your wants and needs.

link.title: Louisville Real Estate Market Update for April 2014

entry.title: Despite Media Reports, Our Real Estate Market is Continuing to Strengthen
entry.content:
There are many great Louisville area homes for sale. Click here to perform a full home search, or if you're thinking of selling your home, click here for a FREE Home Price Evaluation so you know what buyers will pay for your home in today's market. You may also call me at (502) 376-5483 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation to answer any of your real estate questions.

Louisville Real Estate Update: Our Market Continues to Grow
Today I am here to update you on the Louisville real estate market. I wanted to tell you that despite some published reports, the market is recovering and continues to do very well. 

Winter weather in the last 3 months has not encouraged buyers to go out and buy homes. The snow and cold has slowed the market, and that is why the amount of homes sold in March 2014 was down 19.5% from a year before. However, don't let this statistic fool you because in the same month, homes under contract went up by 8.7% as buyers came out and started looking at homes.

Another reason to believe that the market is improving is that we saw a lot of foreclosures and short sales last year. However, if you look at this chart you will see that more expensive homes are starting to sell much better. In fact, sales for homes that are worth $1 million dollars or more are up by 37%. As evidence of this, we recently closed on a million-dollar home in the Spring Farms subdivision. 

So what kind of people are buying homes these days?
Well, 62% of home buyers are repeat buyers. That leaves first time buyers to make up 38% of the market. More good news is that buyers are getting better with their finances, because 78% of all buyers are using their savings for down payment money. 

Looking towards the future, it appears as if this is the time to buy, as interest rates are only expected to rise higher and higher. Rates are projected to go up above 5% by the first quarter of 2015, and theNational Association of Realtors predicts them to reach 5.5%. Interest is still historically low, but it's feared that buyer activity will decrease if rates go up above 5%. 

Buying is also cheaper than renting in all of the 100 largest metro areas in the U.S. by a staggering 38%. So, instead of pouring money into a lease, consider putting it towards the purchase of a home. 

So if you're thinking of buying a home or selling your own, NOW is the time for you to start looking and preparing your home for a sale. Interest rates are sitting right around 4.5-4.65%, so there is not a better time to buy. Get approved, and start looking for your dream home. If you're selling you can expect much less competition because inventory is low, and that means that you have a good chance to get top dollar on your home. 

Once again, if you need any assistance with real estate in Louisville, I urge you to contact me and I would be glad to help you out in any way possible.

link.title: Despite Media Reports, Our Real Estate Market is Continuing to Strengthen

entry.title: Louisville Market Update at Financial Peace University with Dave Ramsey
entry.content:
There are many great Louisville area homes for sale. Click here to perform a full home search, or if you're thinking of selling your home, click here for a FREE Home Price Evaluation so you know what buyers will pay for your home in today's market. You may also call me at (502) 376-5483 for a FREE home buying or selling consultation to answer any of your real estate questions.

Welcome back to my video blog where I'll be talking to you today about what I just saw at the Dave Ramsey show in Brentwood, Tennessee. But before I get to that, let's go over the current market in Louisville.

Louisville Market Update:
  • There has been a great reduction in delinquencies on mortgage payments all across the country, but in Kentucky this number has dropped by 26%. This is a good sign for the economy as well as the real estate market with more people able to pay their bills.
  • Mortgage rates continue to hover around 4.5% to 4.75% which is good news for buyers, but projections are that rates will rise somewhere above 5% this year. This makes me think that it could be the year to buy! If you wait to buy a home until next year, you could be paying an extra $200 per month because of increased mortgage rates.
  • If you're looking to sell, now could also be the time because inventory is still very low. While it's not as low as it was last year, it's still down. If you get your home on the market fast it should sell quickly, but don't wait for the spring and summer rush.
Back to Dave Ramsey and Financial Peace University...

Dave Ramsey is an author and radio host who focuses on how to get people out of debt by paying with cash, and he has authored many books on subjects relating to finance. Currently, he's working on one with his daughter titled Smart Money, Smart Kids.

We also got the time to meet up with a man who helped spread Dave's philosophy: Chris Hogan. He told us that you have to keep your goals in mind, set a time frame to accomplish them, and then go through them sequentially in order to accomplish your goal. Throughout the whole process Chris was adamant that you should not take your eyes off of the prize.

It was pretty amazing seeing all the people that had taken Dave's advice to heart and followed through with his plans, eventually ridding themselves of debt. There were many of these people at the show, and it was pretty powerful to see how many lives Dave had changed.

If you need any help buying or selling, please contact me at (502) 376-5483. I'd be glad to help you!

entry.title: If You’re a Buyer or Seller, I Have Great News For You!
entry.content:
If You’re a Buyer or Seller, I Have Great News For You!

Today I wanted to give buyers and sellers an update for the Louisville real estate market. To mix things up, I wanted to give you the update while I walk through our main office because you never know what is going to happen next. I have some very good news – the market is back! We have been following reports that the market is back to 2006-07 levels which is great news to both buyers and sellers.

Interest rates remain low and since they are hovering around 4.5-5%, it is a good indication that homes sales will come back online again. For the last few weeks, the market has been rather slow due to the cold weather. Let’s face it; the cold weather puts a damper on anyone who wants to look at houses! Trudging ice through homes and being bundled up is not a good mix; we understand this! For buyers, we’re ready to help you at any time. As for sellers, we’re ready to help you and I will elaborate more on this in a moment.

Let’s look at the reports coming in, including a report that is on one of our blogs. According to a very positive USA Today article that ran a few weeks ago named What’s Ahead in the 2014 Housing Market, “The housing recovery hit high gear in 2013 with bigger than expected price gains and solid home sales.” That is great news for sellers and there is good news for buyers as well! Do keep in mind USA Today is speaking nationally in saying the 2013 marker was “up 12.5% in October year over year” and that “prices are now 20% off their 2006 peaks after falling more than 30%.”

For buyers, nationally and somewhat locally, you’re seeing prices return to 2006-07 levels. That is like getting in your DeLorean and heading back through time! For sellers, there is more good news. This is due to the number of homes sold in 2013 was back to 2007 levels. According to Business First in a report we contributed to, the price of homes is also back to 2007 levels. If your home lost equity over the last few years, it should be back!

If you are a buyer ready to go out and look at homes, we’re ready. If you’re a seller and thinking about listing and selling your home this year, give me a call and we will come out and see if there is anything you need to do in terms of maintenance and staging.

I can be reached anytime at (502) 376-5483. Thanks and have a great day!

entry.title: What Can You Expect in 2014?
entry.content:
What Can You Expect in 2014?

 Happy holidays to everybody! I am on the way back from a holiday party hosted by one of the three lending partners we use. I wanted to start with some interesting information coming out of the Olmstead and today’s Century Christmas/Holiday Party. It is rare that we hear predictions for 2014, but that is exactly what we heard today. Jeff Ratanapool was the man making those predications and he has a pretty good track record; he predicted what would happen in 2013. Jeff believes that the first quarter of 2014 has the opportunity to pick up after we see the results of the fourth quarter of 2013. This could allow interest rates to drop below 4% or the rates would stay flat and not move above 5%.

Jeff also thinks that the government will not allow the rates to move above, going against the trend of rising interest rates. The reasoning is that the government will keep the rates low in order to keep buying homes. If interest rates rise just 1%, your monthly payment could rise over a $100. For sellers thinking about listing, your best bet would be putting your home on the market early in the year to take advantage of low inventory. Low inventory means more buyers will be looking at your home.

Additionally, the National Association of Realtors has released information showing that now more than ever, buyers are finding homes on the internet. So for the time being, the prediction is that interest rates will stay low for the beginning of 2014 and level off for the rest of the year. Nonetheless, the housing market is still on the recovery. We also have three great lenders and if you would like more information on them, don’t hesitate to reach out to me.

If you need anything, we are available 24/7 and you can call me at (502) 376-5483. Happy holidays!

entry.title: Should You Buy or Sell?
entry.content:
Should You Buy or Sell?

Here we are getting close to Thanksgiving and the Holiday season, and people always ask if now is a good time to list their home or go out and buy a home. The answer to both is yes! When it comes to selling, most of the homes currently on the market have been listed for a number of months and have been viewed by the buyers. If you list your home now, it’s very fresh to the buyers and it gets attention. When you add our marketing and the hi-res pictures and videos, those homes sell faster.

For buyers, when a new home enters the market, you have less competition at the moment so you can make an offer that’s lower than the asking price. Also, if the seller needs to sell (which is the case this time of year), now is the time you might be able to score a deal. It’s a great time to test the market.

If you need anything, we are available 24/7 and you can call me at (502) 376-5483. We wish each and every one of you a safe and happy Thanksgiving!

entry.title: How You Can Make Healthy Habits That Last?
entry.content:
How You Can Make Healthy Habits That Last?

Greetings from Charleston, South Carolina! Right now I’m on the back of a rickshaw, driven by Joey, taking a tour of the lovely Charleston. The market has slowed down, creating a perfect opportunity to look at homes. The slowdown creates more sellers that are eager to sell, but only providing fewer buyers. The news isn’t all bad for sellers, though. New homes entering the market actually get more attention than homes that have been sitting on the market for a number of months. This may be a seller’s perfect opportunity to get involved. Interest rates have dipped slightly over the last few weeks, now down to 4.35%. Interest rates for 2014 are projected to rise to 5.1-5.3%. Also, owning a home is still 35% cheaper than renting.

The reason I am in Charleston is to share ideas with some of the top realtors around the country. As I spoke with realtors about home sales, I noticed a specific trend nationwide. “It’s been much slower,” said Lee Tessier of Baltimore, Maryland. “It’s nothing like the spring market… Stuff we figured we would sell right away is taking longer to sell,” Lee continued. “Inventory is very low, which is causing many issues from buyers finding properties,” stated Jo Ellen Nash of Naples, Florida.

I asked Joe Modene of Toledo, Ohio what he attributes the slowdown to. “Fear, uncertainty and doubt. You’ve got the budget impasse, the debt ceiling coming up, Obamacare coming in, winter coming in and many economic writers and pundits saying we’re just inches away from another recession.”

A fellow speaker at the event, Jay Papasan, is a contributor and co-author of the book The One Thing. The book details the dangers of multitasking and also how to create habits that last. “We really dug into that research,” Jay stated, “Our big surprise was that it doesn’t take 21 days to form a habit, which is what all the books used to say, it takes 66.” Jay was able to obtain this research from an Australian study that made graduate students form a health habit over a year.

“What they found is that after an average of 66 days, not 21, the habit formed and it got as easy as it’s going to get. If you were waking up early to go to the gym, you got up before the alarm clock,” he continued. Jay recommends picking a New Year’s resolution, and sticking to it until it almost becomes second nature and then moving on to your next goal.

If you have any questions, please give us a call (502) 376-5483. Thanks and have a great day!

link.title: How You Can Make Healthy Habits That Last?

entry.title: The Forecast is Looking Good
entry.content:
The Forecast is Looking Good

As we head into September, here is an update for both buyers and sellers. Market activity remains strong though it has slowed a little bit. As you read more we will give you an update on interest rates and where the market is going.

First, the media continues to cover a story that is three and four months old, but we are going to update you and show you exactly what is happening.  The headlines are saying that home prices are jumping, then they say that home prices going back to normal. It is hard to believe what the media is trying to say, and they are all going on information that is months old.  But what the media hasn’t showed you yet is that the 30 year fixed mortgage rate is increasing, which is slowing sales. All people should take note that the mortgage rates could go over five percent by this time next year.

Both buyers and sellers listen up. Even though interest rates have gone up a bit, home prices are going to go up a lot more. So waiting on the fence could cost you money if you are a buyer. Want to see what’s ahead? Back in 1987 and through 1999 we saw house prices appreciate on about a 3.8 percent on average.  Between 2000 and 2007 that went up to 7.9 percent. But now we are seeing an appreciation of about 4.7 percent through the first half of this year. Over the next couple of years we are looking for appreciation of 4.7 percent as well. So if they are correct there is money to be made in buying a home. Even the analysts who are least optimistic show at least a 13 percent increase by 2017.  So for all of our buyers and sellers just remember the forecast, at least according to some of the experts, looks good.

Of course there are things in the works that we cannot control, or that we have no knowledge of. Syria, for example, is on the minds of a number of people around the world. What will the American government end up doing? We will keep an eye on that because it could very much impact the home sales here in the United States, and here Louisville. The federal government is supposedly thinking that if the unemployment rate hits seven percent or lower, they are going to raise interest rates up above five percent. The scary thing is that it could happen even before those unemployment rates hit that magic number.

If you would like more information about buying or selling a home all you need to do is call us! You can reach us here at (502)376-5483.

link.title: The Forecast is Looking Good

entry.title: The Big Green Egg
entry.content:
Hey everyone! I’m at the fifth annual Brownsboro EGGFest. If you don’t know what EggFest is we’ll tell you!

So far the month of August, the home sales are hot. We are still seeing an increase in sales and prices. One thing I should tell you, though, is interest rates have increased to about 4.5&-4.65%. This has slowed the market not only in Louisville, but nationwide as well. Once buyers adapt to the new interest rates and they realize those rates won’t drop, we should see an increase in the market again.

More about the Egg now! I just bought my first one a couple months ago and it has changed my life. It’s not just me; listen to everyone here!

The Egg has changed the way people cook with its mushroom design and small dent cap at the top. The temperature inside the Egg remains constant. It’s great for almost anything you can think of.

Jim Lehrer, owner of Brownsboro Hardware, has been selling these for years. The Green Egg is a ceramic grill; it’s really known for smoking.

There are five different sizes of Green Eggs. The small one will cost you a couple hundred bucks, the extra large will cost you about a thousand dollars, though. Many would say, myself included, that it’s worth it.

Laurence Agnew and Timothy Haller of Main Street Café would definitely recommend using it!

You can cook anything: pizza, ribs, pork and everything tastes great! I’m not being paid to say that, just being honest!


If you are thinking about buying or selling a home please give me a call! Thank you for watching!

Interest rates are up. They have increased by about a point over the past month and they are projected to hit about 5%-6%. Buyers do not wait. We may never see interest rates as low as 3.5% in our lifetime again, so it’s best to buy now before rates continue to increase.

Sellers! If you are thinking about selling your home, know that the number of pending sales is way up! Home prices are projected to go up between 3.8%-17.6% in the next few years. That is all variable, however, on where in Louisville you are.

We just put a home on the market yesterday in the St. Matthews area. We’ve had multiple showings, one offer (almost full price offer) and are expecting more! If you go in other areas of Louisville, though, the market is a lot slower.

entry.title: Multiple Offer Situations
entry.content:
Hey everyone! Welcome back to my video blog! As you can see I am in Las Vegas for a couple real estate conventions and folks, there’s some important news for you!

Multiple Offer Situations

Top agents from across the country gathered and reported the same problem for buyers: multiple offer situations.

Renee Butler of Polk County Florida says she receives multiples offers on homes in the $100k-$200k price range within two weeks.

Lee Tessier of Hartford County Maryland reports that 70% of his listings are selling within two weeks.

This is great news if you’re a seller but as Brad Korb from Burbank, California says there just isn’t enough inventory for buyers. When they do find a home, they often face multiple offer situations and the price becomes too high.

Buyers are fighting over homes and prices are going up too quickly in some areas. This brings us to our next problem.

Low Appraisals

Appraisers are working off of three-year-old guidelines from when we had a receding home market. Now with the market as hot as it is, many agents are asking their clients to get pre-appraisals.

According to Collier Swecker of Birmingham, Alabama, appraisers are extremely conservative and sellers need to get their homes priced properly. Those that are following this suggestion are selling their homes a lot faster than those who don’t.

The last wrinkle in real estate reports interest rates are up and buyers may slow down purchasing homes. We continue to tell our buyers that even with interest rates inching up a bit, they are still historically low compared to years past!

One Final Thing!

One of the things we’re looking forward to is working with John Tesh who used to co-anchor Entertainment Tonight! He is coming back to television! We are hoping to work with John in reporting real estate news and getting you connected with experts to answer your questions!

John Tesh is a wonderful guy and we hope to work with him in the near future! If you have any questions about getting a pre-appraisal, buying or selling your home, don’t hesitate to give us a call at 502.376.5483 !

entry.title: Practicality and Beauty Combine in Landscaping Trend
entry.content:
Watch on your mobile device >> 

It’s springtime, which means it’s time to do some planting. We talked with one of the owners at Starview Greenhouse to find out about the trends and were shocked to learn it’s plants you can eat that are all the rage. It’s called edible landscaping.  Whether it’s blueberries, blackberries, raspberries, tomatoes, anything edible is really big this year. You can not only eat these plants, but they add color as well, not only in the spring, but in the fall as well. 

Another new trend isn’t what type of plant it is, but rather is the vegetable disease resistant to the spotted cucumber beetle and striped cucumber beetle? Usually if it’s a hybrid, it’s disease resistant. Also, if you’re planting tomatoes, go for ones such as the Big Boy or Celebrity varieties because you can get 40 to 50 pounds per plant. These types are “no-miss plants” because they really grow. In addition, ground cover is a little different than in the past. “Steppables,” which are plants that are 1 to 2 inches tall that you can walk on, are popular. 

Plants, flowers and vegetables improve the look of your yard. They add to your home’s curb appeal, which in turn helps sell your home. If you’d like more information on Starview Greenhouse, give me a call. 

If you would like to build a strategy to market your home or find the home of your dreams, please contact me at (502) 376-5483 or bob@WeSellLouisville.com.  We’d love to hear from you.

link.title: Practicality and Beauty Combine in Landscaping Trend

entry.title: Home Staging Tips From the Pros That Work Well for Parties or (Buyer) Prospects
entry.content:
Watch on your mobile device >>

Here we are approaching Kentucky Derby time again and with that, it’s time for lots of great parties. One of the things our veteran staging expert suggests to prepare a home for these parties is to stage the space. Sure, staging is synonymous with selling a home but it also works when you have to spruce up the place in time for guests to come over.

Invite People Inside With a Gorgeous Outside Space

Believe it or not, little things like installing attractive garden lighting or keeping shrubs and trees trimmed – make an excellent first impression. The first thing guests (or buyers) will want to do when they see a nicely done exterior is look forward to seeing the rest of the home.

Take Away All the Guesswork

It’s easy to pile on years of stuff in a home and it’s even easier with our busy schedule to allow those things to clutter our space. But when you’re preparing for a party or staging to sell your home, you want to be able to show off the home’s features. Clutter can mask the beauty of a home, making it difficult for anyone to truly enjoy the space.

Highlight High-Traffic Areas of the House

The most central location in a house is the kitchen whether you are entertaining or seeking to sell your home. It is the most used space particularly when entertaining. Buyers want to know the kitchen is functional but also that it’s updated with nice cabinetry, good counters and appliances with attractive flooring too. By setting up just a few nice pieces on the counter tops you will highlight the beautiful features of the kitchen rather than hide them.

Create a Smooth Flow Within Rooms

An important and often overlooked aspect of setting up a home’s furnishings is to do it in a way that allows people to freely move from one area to another. Create flow from one seating area to the next by setting up clear walkways and unobstructed paths. A great way to maximize the flow of a room is to utilize the space behind couches and chairs by floating them in the center of rooms.

Simplify Décor and Keep It Neutral

The last thing you want is for your guests to be overwhelmed with so many accessories that they can’t see the house itself. Bookshelves should be simply stocked, with a limited number of accessories on display. Choose larger, more expensive pieces and artfully set them up along with other pieces that complement one another. Look online for inspiration or set up in groupings of items that are similar in color. Also pay attention to scale; large furniture in small rooms will always make the rooms seem much smaller.
~
Whether selling your home is on the agenda or simply setting up a great party for friends this Kentucky Derby season – these tips are sure to help you with surefire success! And if you are in the market to sell your home, contact us today. We’d love to help you!

link.title: Home Staging Tips From the Pros That Work Well for Parties or (Buyer) Prospects

entry.title: The Louisville Market Takes Off
entry.content:
Watch on your mobile device >>

Quite simply, the market is hot.  We haven’t seen a market like this in the past five years with great variables in play—low inventory, prices increasing, and days on market decreasing.  Whether you’re a seller or buyer, now’s the time.

If you’re thinking of selling, there are lots of buyers out there and fewer homes on the market.  Normally, there are 7,000 to 8,000 homes, but currently only 6,250—and that number is shrinking.  If you’re thinking of selling this year or even in the next six months, think of selling sooner rather than later because by putting your home on the market now, you’ll be up against less competition, which will make your home look much better.

To get top dollar when selling your property, you should take advantage of the low inventory.  Here’s the thing:  supply and demand affect what you’ll get for your home.  When everyone who has been thinking about selling their home puts their home on the market is not the time to dive in—if you want to get the most out of your home.  By waiting until spring (the typical time people put the For Sale sign up), you’ll have lots of homes to compete with.  When the supply of homes goes up, the price you’ll get for your home inevitably goes down.  At the end of the day, you have a better chance at success selling your home now, instead of waiting until all the Joneses get into the market.

So what does this all mean for the buyer?  Since there are far fewer homes on the market, there’s lots of competition for those available homes.  Here are a few tips.  When a home that you’re interested in hits the market, plan to see it as soon as possible and make the best possible offer that’s at an appropriate price point for the seller.  Remember, inventory is low.  If you hesitate, the property could be gone tomorrow because others will be making offers.

Keep in mind that interest rates are going up.  They were 3.25% a month ago, are hovering at 3.65 and may be over 4% by the end of the year.  The current rate still makes buying a home more affordable, but as you can see, these rates won’t last forever, so there’s not a better time to buy than now.  When interest rates rise, you could get locked into spending a few hundred extra dollars a month on your payment.  Ouch!  

To help buyers, we’ve started a new series to help them avoid mistakes.  Check out the link at the bottom of this web site for this new video series, which will be available in a couple of weeks.  My new book that I co-authored called “The Ultimate Homebuyers’ Guide” will be out soon with all proceeds going to Crusade for Children and the Children’s Miracle Network Telethon.  Check it out!

For more information about the Louisville real estate market or to work with the hardest working Louisville real estate team, please contact me at (502) 376-5483 or bob@WeSellLouisville.com.  We’d love to hear from you.

link.title: The Louisville Market Takes Off

There are so many signs that things have turned around.  Buyer signs are everywhere.  Take a look at the real estate news, and you’ll see that real estate searches on the Internet are up 253% over the past four years.  And 95% are looking on the Internet to find information about homes.  Thanks to smart phones, the buyer can be can be sitting anywhere—at home, work, restaurant and even waiting in line—and actively searching for homes.  Because of the number of smart phones, we created the LouisvillePropertyOnline.com mobile application.

So who’s buying these days?  Everybody, including those between the ages of 25 and 34.  The younger generation now makes up the largest percentage of homebuyers, but they’re not the only ones.  Seniors are shopping for homes with 75 % of seniors going online to search for a home.
 
If you’re thinking about buying, now is the time to take advantage of low interest rates.  A 30-year fixed-rate mortgage hovered at record-low rates during 2012.  These rates have helped make home-buying affordable, but the rates won’t last forever, so there’s not a better time to buy than now.  An increase in rates can translate into paying tens of thousands of dollars more.

entry.title: Real Estate Market Comes Back Across the US Marketplace
entry.content:
Watch on your mobile device >>

At a recent conference in Charleston, South Carolina I had the good fortune to connect with many of our peers in the real estate industry throughout the US. Each year we come together to learn all that we can about the top ways to service our clients, both buyers and sellers.

Talking to fellow agents, I learned a lot about what is happening around our country lately with the market smoking hot and on fire in many areas. Here’s what they had to say:

Amanda Howard from Huntsville, Alabama says sales are steady across the county but in their office, sales are up with multiple offers and many listings are selling in less than 30 days. The average number of days on market in their county is currently 120 days but Amanda’s office is enjoying a 30-day average DOM.

Kathy Toth of Ann Arbor, Michigan shares that their market is going up about a half percent each month! Inventory continues to shrink down and they are seeing multiple offers on many properties. She says that staging and effective pricing are key factors for their marketplace right now.

James Nellis from Alexandria, Virginia cites a lack of inventory that is creating a sellers’ environment in their marketplace. Many sellers are seeing top dollar for their homes compared to the way things have been over the past several years. Multiple offer situations are not uncommon right now plus buyers AND sellers are both getting what they want out of deals.

Sandy Raines of Columbus, Ohio is also enjoying multiple offers in her hometown. In fact, she mentions two properties listed on a Friday recently where both were under contract before the weekend was over!

Marti Hampton in Raleigh, North Carolina has not quite seen pre-2006 market levels but with the number of homes on the market continuously going down, particularly with fewer homes in the city’s top neighborhoods, she warns buyers not to be too overconfident these days.

Lonnie Bush from Virginia Beach also says that while their real estate environment hasn’t quite reached pre-housing crash levels they are doing great! The number of days on market has dropped to just 90 days now and they are having a great year!

Collier Swecker and Howard Whatley from Birmingham, Alabama both say that this market has been doing very well with prices up, business on the rise and most of the properties under $250k flying off the market.
~
Right here in Louisville, though we’re not seeing multiple offers on a regular basis we are seeing homes that are going under contract very quickly.

The news is good for both buyers and sellers. Buyers can expect great deals out there still, with low interest rates but they do have to act fact because with inventory levels so low they could lose the home of their dreams.

Sellers should really think about selling now rather than waiting; with so many buyers on the prowl looking to lock in amazing rates, why not list it soon and get it sold? Not to mention, fewer homes on the market means less competition.

Contact us today to see homes or talk about listing your home. We look forward to helping make your real estate dreams become a reality!

link.title: Real Estate Market Comes Back Across the US Marketplace

entry.title: Emergency Preparedness Tips - Keep Your Family Safe
entry.content:
Watch on your mobile device >>

As Hurricane Sandy devastates the East Coast, we first must send our thoughts and prayers to everyone affected by this tragedy.  As we move forward, no matter where you are, you must prepare for a disaster to occur in your community.  Hoping for the best, yet planning for the worst can save lives. 

Make a Plan

Having a plan set in place is the best way to avert disaster in times of crisis.  First, have a family meeting so everyone is on the same page.  Establish the best escape routes from your home and pick a place to meet after everyone is out of harm’s way.  If you have small children, make sure they know how to spell their last name, an adult’s contact phone number, and how to dial 9-1-1 in case they become separated.  Mark your calendars to review your plan every six months.

Stock Up

You should keep enough supplies at home to meet the needs of you and your family for at least 3 days.  This includes water, dry food, dry clothes, battery powered radio, flashlight with extra batteries and a first aid kit.  If you purchase these items in small quantities at a time and stow them away for use solely in an emergency, it need not be expensive and you need not encounter the crowds that descend upon retail stores in the days and hours before a disaster strikes. 

To get more tips on how to safely prepare your family for disaster, click here.

Also, FEMA has a guide book you can go through with your family for basic disaster preparedness, which you can view here.

link.title: Emergency Preparedness Tips - Keep Your Family Safe

entry.title: Lower Interest Rates = LOTS More Money In Your Pocket
entry.content:
Watch on your mobile device >>

Chances are you have heard that mortgage interest rates are super low these days. But do you know HOW low they are? Believe it or not, most people don’t have credit cards with interest rates at these levels, let alone mortgages. But truth be told, more and more homeowners are enjoying this maneuver of the Fed to get our economy (and housing market) pumping.

Just today, though they fluctuate a tiny bit each day, our interest rates registered at about 3%. THREE percent!! And the big news is that they are rumored to be on target for dropping below 3% in the coming months. Now this is for the conventional 30-year fixed rate loans. Plug in the numbers for a 15-year fixed rate and you can lock in rates in the TWOs already – no need to wait until 2014 or beyond.

Let’s look at the example I mentioned on the video:

With a $300,000 mortgage, at an interest rate of 6% (one that many existing homeowners are currently paying) the monthly mortgage amount would be about $1800. Bring that interest rate number down to today’s 3% and the monthly payment suddenly slides down to about $1265. That’s a huge savings of about $530 a month! If you were to channel those funds right back into your mortgage, imagine how much savings in time (and interest) you could accumulate.

The total savings amount for this example is over $190,000!

That’s why over the past couple years many homeowners are going back for one, two and sometimes even more refinances on their properties and locking in amazing savings month after month after month.

A few things to know about preparing for a refinance: just like any other major financial transaction, you will need to provide documentation of your banking history, employment and paycheck stubs, tax returns for the past several years and anything else that may have an impact on your application.

As always, you can contact us to help you through this or any other real estate endeavors. And if you haven’t considered it already – consider it now! Lock in these phenomenal mortgage interest rates! Call or email at 502 376 5483 / bob@weselllouisville.com.

entry.title: Louisville Real Estate Market Update – September 2012
entry.content:
Watch on your mobile device >>

Who doesn’t love some good news? Especially when it comes to the real estate market! Well today, we’ve got some GREAT news. Across the board in the nation we are seeing existing homes sale go up, inventory go down and fewer distressed properties on the market than we’ve seen in a while. Here’s a breakdown of the numbers both nationally and locally:

National Market Snapshot

Nationally, homes sales rose 8.6% this year from last year on average. We are seeing 33% fewer distressed properties on the market this year – marking a better situation for many Americans. Inventory levels are down 24.4% with a favorable market for sellers, ending up with multiple offer situations and even bidding wars in some areas. Mortgage rates have continued to fall, with the latest dip going to 0.86% lower. This makes our marketplace uniquely favorable for both buyers and sellers alike. The not-so-good news is that home prices still remain at pre-2003 levels so that means it will take at least three to five years before we can expect to see better prices.

Louisville Market Snapshot

In our own area we are experiencing better market conditions as compared to the rest of the country – with prices only down 2.86% in 2012 compared to 2007. We’ve been ranked 27th in a Business First article where we also recognized as being the 14th in terms housing prices recovery.

The good news is that we see the rest of the year remaining flat – meaning you can expect neither to lose money nor gain value on your home. However once the New Year rolls around we do expect a slow and steady increase as the market picks up again. We don’t anticipate anything too ambitious but we will likely see increases in the one to two percentage points’ range.
~
